body_html: This makes sense, as we cut out the simulator architecture when building the library. If you tried to build your app against the library for the simulator architecture, then it will fail. I believe that, by default, Xcode won't build for all architectures, but it will if you switch your scheme's build configuration to be release rather than debug (at least that's how it was in my Xcode).
body_text: This makes sense, as we cut out the simulator architecture when building the library.  If you tried to build your app against the library for the simulator architecture, then it will fail.  I believe that, by default, Xcode won't build for all architectures, but it will if you switch your scheme's build configuration to be release rather than debug (at least that's how it was in my Xcode).
body: This makes sense, as we cut out the simulator architecture when building the library.  If you tried to build your app against the library for the simulator architecture, then it will fail.  I believe that, by default, Xcode won't build for all architectures, but it will if you switch your scheme's build configuration to be release rather than debug (at least that's how it was in my Xcode).
